vulnerabilities.vulnerability: Absence of formal threat-assessment programs or inconsistent team operation.
ofcs: Establish multidisciplinary behavioral threat assessment teams.
Adopt standardized operating procedures aligned with REMS and USSS NTAC guidance.

vulnerabilities.vulnerability: Leakage of intent or threats not acted upon by peers or staff.
ofcs: Implement anonymous reporting systems (Safe2Tell, Stop It).
Train staff and students to identify and report warning behaviors.

vulnerabilities.vulnerability: Information silos between schools, law enforcement, and mental health providers.
ofcs: Develop MOUs for information sharing within FERPA/HIPAA bounds.
Assign liaison officers to connect school, police, and behavioral health resources.

vulnerabilities.vulnerability: Disciplinary removals without follow-up support or reintegration.
ofcs: Pair disciplinary actions with re-entry plans and monitoring.
Coordinate with counselors to maintain engagement post-incident.

vulnerabilities.vulnerability: Concerning behaviors observed by multiple staff not linked together.
ofcs: Centralize behavior reports in a single digital system.
Ensure threat teams can review cross-staff observations in real time.

vulnerabilities.vulnerability: Lack of accessible mental-health resources for at-risk students.
ofcs: Expand partnerships with community mental-health providers.
Embed counselors and social workers in threat-assessment teams.

vulnerabilities.vulnerability: No proactive monitoring of social-media indicators.
ofcs: Develop policies for monitoring public social-media threats.
Train staff on recognizing online indicators of targeted violence.

vulnerabilities.vulnerability: Unsecured access to firearms in homes of subjects.
ofcs: Conduct firearm-safety and secure-storage awareness campaigns.
Work with law enforcement for temporary removal under risk-protection laws.

vulnerabilities.vulnerability: Lack of structured after-action reviews following averted attacks.
ofcs: Create post-incident review processes to capture lessons learned.
Update threat-assessment protocols after every averted incident.

vulnerabilities.vulnerability: Negative or exclusionary school climate fostering alienation.
ofcs: Implement social-emotional learning and anti-bullying programs.
Promote inclusive activities and mentorship opportunities.
